Thanks so why was this a journey well
mostly because on first listen I kind of
hated it well maybe I didn't all and out
hate it hate it but I was kind of like I
was kind of like this and maybe it's
because I usually like a lot of sonic
beef a lot of color to my music and the
radio Department for the most part are
an easy breezy Swedish pop band who
sound like My Bloody Valentine being
forced to start a Pet Shop Boys tribute
group and there was a lot turning me off
about this LP initially but you know I
had to listen to it deeper if I was
gonna do a review because I wanted to
find out why I didn't like it there were
a lot of cheesy scents that reminded me
of 90s radio pop plus a lot of very
sedate vocals that didn't feel too
engaging to me at first and plus the
music just had this middle-of-the-road
thing going on it was dreamy but not too
dreamy it was poppy but not too poppy I
just kind of felt like maybe it didn't
know what direction I wanted to go in
and also what's with the smoking I have
a theory about albums where they're
smoking on the front cover I I don't
like them however this theory time and
time again is being disproven it's
really not all that good of a theory
it's a small tea theory but after
multiple
listens to this new LP which wasn't hard
because the songs are pretty
straightforward in the album is pretty
short I've started to catch some
elements that I really really loved I
was getting past any hang-ups I was
having and I truly started to feel like
these reservations were kind of melting
away and I was starting to see the radio
department for what they were I was
starting to enjoy the relaxed melodies
the very moderate hypnotic tempos and
the very pleasant synthesizer sounds -
it was kind of like listening to a dance
party in slow motion or let her like
medium motion not so much slow but
medium mid motion and initially I saw
the sound of this album as being very
hollow very vacant and right now at this
point I can't say I'm on the opposite
side of the aisle not really there but I
am starting to hear and starting to
appreciate how much of an influence
shoegaze has on this release sure
there's a lot of New Wave influence on
this LP
a lot of synth pop influence on this LP
but the radio department conjures a lot
of walls of sound - but they're not
really harsh or distorted they're very
light and soft and embracing the sound
of this LP is definitely not deafening I
would almost say it's ambient if the
songs weren't so engaging and I'm really
starting to enjoy the hooks to the heavy
reverb on the vocals make translation of
the lyrics a little difficult from time
to time however I think the mood of this
album is actually more important than
understanding the words in the songs and
I think I pretty much owe my enjoyment
of this album to several tracks that on
first listen did impress me despite the
fact that I might have been on the fence
at first with this LP like the upbeat
reggae influenced keyboards on follows
suit the very jangling shimmering
guitars on the opening track domestic
scene and the very robotic drum beat and
plethora of instrumentation on the track
David all these moments kind of just
engrained themselves into my head
after first listen and even though I may
not have enjoyed the LP the first time
around I said wait a second let's go
back to these tracks because there's
something here one major gripe that I do
have something that I don't think I'm
going to get past is that whether it's
the sound the mix the production
whatever a few tracks on this release do
come off kind of thin and tinny almost
to the point where it hurts my ears if I
turn it up loud maybe it's intentional
but that doesn't mean I have to like it
but still this is a really solid release
and a great third album for this project
none of the songs really stuck out as
being bad to me but if you're looking
for an LP that has a blood trail leading
all the way back to the late 80s and
early 90s something that is kind of easy
listening for the indie crowd just some
drum machine pop with calm as hell
vocals then this is where you want to be
I'm feeling a decent too strong eight on
